thread.title: Wildfire along U.S. 285 near Indian Hills prompts evacuations, briefly shutters highway
thread.title_full: Wildfire along U.S. 285 near Indian Hills prompts evacuations, briefly shutters highway

author: Jesse Paul
title: Wildfire along U.S. 285 near Indian Hills prompts evacuations, briefly shutters highway
text:
Editorial: Trump’s tinfoil hat theories debunked, where do we go from here? 
A wildfire along U.S. 285 just west of Indian Hills on Tuesday afternoon has prompted evacuations and briefly closed the highway. 
The fire is burning near where North Turkey Creek Road meets South Turkey Creek Road. A photo from the scene showed heavy smoke pouring from an area near U.S. 285. 
Both directions of U.S. 285 were closed for about an hour as fire crews respond to the scene. Both southbound lanes and a northbound lane was back open by 3 p.m. 
Several local fire agencies are responding. Fire burning on 285 @ N Turkey Creek #KDVR #KWGN pic.twitter.com/T0XUeOo7t0 
— Ashley Michels (@ReporterAshley) March 22, 2017 
The West Ranch Center and area residences have been evacuated. Motorists were being asked to avoid the area. 
Jeffco Public Schools says that none of its schools have been evacuated. Pictures from our crew on scene at the fire on US 285. Both directions remain closed at North Turkey Creek due to fire. pic.twitter.com/s5ATvhRN8X
